head.title: Starry, Starry Lights, For Dark, Dark Nights

hedline.hl1: Starry, Starry Lights, For Dark, Dark Nights

abstract.p: Personal Web Shopper column on laterns, candleholders, party lights and other kinds of lighting for patio, porch and garden (M)

block.p: Moonlight may be magic, but there is never enough of it. To create your own magic, you can decorate with oil lanterns, party lights and candleholders to provide illumination for a glittering occasion, or at least a twinkling one. All of these can be purchased on the Web; there are also toll-free phone numbers.

1. Six paper lanterns, 12 inches in diameter in a rainbow of colors, come with an electric light set; $73.95 from www.japanesegifts.com or (877) 226-4387. 2. A metal fish-shaped candleholder with blown-glass scales comes with a stake that adjusts from 16 inches to 54 inches high. Or the lantern can be placed on a table or ledge; it is $29.99 from www.gardenerssupply.com. or (888) 833-1412. 3. Oil lamp torchiers on 59-inch metal poles with blown-glass oil containers are $98 for six. One quart of lamp oil is $9. From www.smithandhawken.com or (800) 940-1170. 4. Bumblebee-shaped lanterns hold tea lights or votive candles; a set of three (one red, one yellow and one blue) is $24.95 from www.gardenerssupply.com. 5. Tamarassk striped paper lanterns (to fit over light bulbs) are eight inches high, and come in a set of 10 for $16 from www.restorationhardware.com or (800) 762-1005.
